remarks: Substituting polynomials for the variables of a polynomial results in a polynomial. ` G ` is expected to depend on ` y ` and provide the polynomials which are being substituted.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 5-Oct-2014.)
statement:
mzpsubst $p |- ( ( W e. _V /\ F e. ( mzPoly ` V ) /\ A. y e. V G e. ( mzPoly ` W ) ) -> ( x e. ( ZZ ^m W ) |-> ( F ` ( y e. V |-> ( G ` x ) ) ) ) e. ( mzPoly ` W ) ) $.
$d F x $.
$d G x $.
$d V x y $.
$d W x y $.
